project.name: Inspect
project.title: An Air Campaign Planning Evaluation Aid

description.short: is an air campaign plan critiquing tool. Current funding is supporting thechnology transition to the Joint Defense Planner, which is on the path to becoming an integral part of TBMCS. INSPECT was originally developed under the DARPA Rome Laboratory Planning Initiative, and was demonstrated at the first US Air Force Expeditionary Force Experiment (EFX-98).
description.long:
is a plan evaluation tool that was built using the EXPECT framework to develop knowledge-based systems. was initially developed as part of the work that the EXPECT project is doing under the the DARPA/Rome Laboratory Planning Initiative (ARPI) to create tools that support the US military in developing air campaigns. is now being extended in several important dimensions under the DARPA JFACC program.
takes an air campaign plan that has been manually developed and looks for possible problems that a user may have overlooked, such as inconsistencies or unrealistic use of resources. An important part of the work on was the development of structured representations (or grammars) for air campaign plans.
was an integral part of two important demonstrations: ARPI's Fourth Integrated Feasibility Demonstration (IFD-4) in June 1996 and the Jumpstart Demonstration of the DARPA JFACC program in January 1997.

research.short: Generating explanations and justifications, ISR, strategy and plan rationale.
research.long:
is being extended in several important dimensions under the DARPA JFACC program. Some of these extensions require basic R&D work on the EXPECT framework on generating explanations and justifications for 's recommendations, and on Web-based tools to support domain experts to change 's knowledge base. Other extensions will widen the scope of 's evaluations to do the following:
Include additional types of objectives (such as force support (logistics) and force enhancement (ISR - intelligence, Surveillance and reconaissance).
Evaluate the plan from a more global perspective that would include information about strategy and plan rationale.
